net.adamcin.commons.testing.junit

Class FailUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.adamcin.commons.testing.junit.FailUtil

  • public final class FailUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for handling the JUnit Assert.fail() method and printing relevant stacktrace information for exceptions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FailUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void sprintFail(Throwable ex)
      Convenience method which calls Assert.fail(String) with a message created from the stack trace provided by ex
      static String sprintFullStack(Throwable t)
      Extract the full stacktrace from t into a String for logging
      static String sprintShortStack(Throwable t)
      Like sprintFullStack(Throwable), renders a stacktrace as a String for logging, but excludes stack trace elements common with the calling scope, which may be considered irrelevant to application functionality testing

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FailUtil

        public FailUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • sprintFullStack

        public static String sprintFullStack(Throwable t)
        Extract the full stacktrace from t into a String for logging
        Parameters:
        t - an exception
        Returns:
        a string representation of the full stack trace

      • sprintShortStack

        public static String sprintShortStack(Throwable t)
        Like sprintFullStack(Throwable), renders a stacktrace as a String for logging, but excludes stack trace elements common with the calling scope, which may be considered irrelevant to application functionality testing
        Parameters:
        t - an exception
        Returns:
        a string representation of a shorter stack trace

      • sprintFail

        public static void sprintFail(Throwable ex)
        Convenience method which calls Assert.fail(String) with a message created from the stack trace provided by ex
        Parameters:
        ex - an exception
